snippet: The fighting, in Nangarhar Province, started with the killing of a tribal elder by the Taliban.
abstract: Taliban fighters kill 22 Afghan police officers in ambush of their convoy in an eastern providence bordering Pakistan; it is one of deadliest episodes in power struggle between insurgents and Afghan government that has intensified as American-led forces prepare to leave Afghanistan after more than a decade of war.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and SHARIFULLAH SAHAK
byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozai contributed reporting from Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The fighting, in Nangarhar Province, started with the killing of a tribal elder by the Taliban.

headline.main: Scores Killed in 2 Days of Clashes Between Afghan Police and Taliban Fighters
headline.print_headline: Scores Killed in 2 Days of Clashes Between Afghan Police and Taliban Fighters
